body:
I would like to have separate spack installations to hold packages for different processor architectures (which are on different machines) but where both processors use the same network file share . I know it is supposed to be possible for them to share one spack installation but one system (an aarch54) is a bit slow and has corrupted the installation a couple of times. 

I have tried cloning spack into a different directory ("armspack") but it spack on first opertation creates the auxiliary directory ".spack". My other installation (for Intel processors) would also want to use ".spack". Can I in fact control the name of this auxiliary directory? I cannot find a setting for it.
title: separate spack installations for different processor architectures
